verses.roman:
tāṅra aṅga-gandhe daśa dik āmodita
bhūṣaṇa-dhvanite karṇa haya camakita

synonyms: tāṅra—her; aṅga-gandhe—the scent of the body; daśa dik—ten directions; āmodita—perfumed; bhūṣaṇa-dhvanite—by the tinkling of her ornaments; karṇa—the ear; haya—becomes; camakita—startled.
translation: The scent of her body perfumed all directions, and the tinkling of her ornaments startled the ear.
